Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support because it is based on a single poll and does not take into account other surveys that show lower levels of support for Medicare for All.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that support for improved and expanded Medicare for All is the same as support for the specific policy proposals put forward by Ocasio-Cortez and other Democrats.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the level of support for Medicare for All, such as the wording of the survey questions and the inclusion of options to retain private insurance.
Understate: The claim may understate the level of support for Medicare for All by only focusing on the 70 percent figure and not considering higher levels of support when certain conditions are met.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it combines support for different versions of Medicare for All and does not fully clarify the details and implications of the policy.
Contradict fact: The claim may contradict the fact that support for Medicare for All is not as high as claimed, as shown by other surveys that have found lower levels of support.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the level of support for Medicare for All by presenting the 70 percent figure without considering other survey results that show lower levels of support.
